Detailed Description

template<typename T, const unsigned int D, typename S = k_vector<vector_distance<T>, vector_distance<T> >>
class kd_tree< T, D, S >

Template for generic cache-aware kd-trees of any type.

Element insertions and deletions are not currently supported in behalf of a design based on cache efficiency.

Warning:
This class is currently not thread-safe. This feature will be added in future releases.
Template Parameters:
T Data type of the elements in the kd-tree. Requires copy, internal + += = *, external (* int) and comparison < <= > operators.
D Number of dimensions in the input data.
S (Optional) K-best elements container. Responds to empty, size, back, push_back and pop_front. Defaults to k_vector<vector_distance<T>, vector_distance<T> >, but k_heap<vector_distance<T>, vector_distance<T> > is also valid.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T , const unsigned int D, typename S >
void kd_tree< T, D, S >::all_in_range ( const kd_point &  p,
T  distance,
std::vector< kd_neighbour > &  output,
bool  ignore_p_in_tree = false 
) const [inline]

Get all neighbours within a distance from a point. Estimated average Cost: O(log m log n) depending on the number of results m.

Find the K nearest neighbours of a given kd_point and push their indices sorted into a given STL vector. In case that there are not enough kd_points in the tree, all the available ones will be provided.

Parameters:
p Point whose K neighbours should be retrieved.
distance Euclidean distance margin used to retrieve all points within.
output STL vector where the neighbours within the specified range will be appended. Elements are not sorted by distance.
ignore_p_in_tree Assume that p is contained in the tree any number of times and ignore them all.
template<typename T , const unsigned int D, typename S >
bool kd_tree< T, D, S >::build ( const kd_point *  points,
unsigned int  num_points,
unsigned int  bucket_size = 32 
) [inline]

Build a kd-tree from a set of input points. Cost: O(n log² n).

Build a kd-tree from a set of n D-dimensional samples.

Parameters:
points Array of contiguous D-dimensional kd_points.
num_points Number of elements in p.
bucket_size Number of elements that should be grouped in leaf nodes.
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise.
template<typename T, const unsigned int D, typename S = k_vector<vector_distance<T>, vector_distance<T> >>

Get the number of elements stored in the tree.

template<typename T , const unsigned int D, typename S >
void kd_tree< T, D, S >::knn ( const kd_point &  p,
unsigned int  K,
std::vector< kd_neighbour > &  output,
T  epsilon = (T) 0,
bool  ignore_p_in_tree = false 
) const [inline]

Get the K nearest neighbours of a point. Estimated average cost: O(log K log n).

Find the K nearest neighbours of a given kd_point and push their indices sorted into a given STL vector. In case that there are not enough kd_points in the tree, all the available ones will be provided.

Parameters:
p Point whose K neighbours should be retrieved.
K Number of nearest neighbours to retrieve.
output STL vector where the nearest neighbours will be appended. Sorted result depends on the template parameter S, enabled by default.
epsilon Acceptable distance margin to ignore regions during kd-tree exploration. Defaults to zero (deterministic).
ignore_p_in_tree Assume that p is contained in the tree any number of times and ignore them all.
template<typename T , const unsigned int D, typename S >
const kd_tree< T, D, S >::kd_point & kd_tree< T, D, S >::operator[] ( unsigned int  index  )  const [inline]

Subscripting operator to access kd-tree data.

Parameters:
index Index of the data being accessed.
Returns:
Reference to the index-th element provided when building the tree (internal copy).
